summary: I absolutely loved Arya killing the night king but I feel like it would have been cooler if it had been him and Jon fighting one...
body: I absolutely loved Arya killing the night king but I feel like it would have been cooler if it had been him and Jon fighting one on one and just as the night king is about to kill Bran and Jon Arya swoops in and they kill him together but not before he manages to hit her with a fatal blow and the entire army collapses as she and the night king do and then they cut to Daenerys holding Jorah and crying to Jon holding Arya crying and Sansa, Gendry, Davos, Tormund, the hound, and Brienne make it over there to find Jon and Bran and celebrate and they see Jon holding her body and crying with bran watching and they start to mourn her and just when they think all hope is lost Melissandre walks in and bran looks at her and says “what do we say to the god of death?” then she kneels over Arya and puts her hand on her and says “not today” and then the episode ends with Arya suddenly taking a sharp breath in and opening her eyes then it cuts to black, I don’t know I feel like that would have been cooler but maybe that’s just me

tags: Please for the love of God
summary: Smutty Fic Prompt I NEED To Be Written.  Like I’ve never dabbled in writing smut otherwise I would try myself, inspired by ‘It’s...
body:
Smutty Fic Prompt I NEED To Be Written.

Like I’ve never dabbled in writing smut otherwise I would try myself, inspired by ‘It’s Raining Men’ by The Weather Girls.

The ladies of Westeros attend a charity bachelor action where the lovely men of Westeros are being auctioned off as dates. Of course hilarity ensues because they go over the top with their little striptease show. Robb, Jon, Gendry, Theon, etc with Arya, Sansa, Margaery, etc. Basically besides the main guys and Arya and Sansa, the rest of the characters are up to your discretion.

I can totally see Theon making a fool of himself in a cute embarrassing way.

So Arya and Gendry are friends who flirt a lot but never revealed their feelings for each other.

Arya sees all the ladies totally swooning over Gendry and gets insanely jealous therefore spending a large amount of money to keep them away from him.

Gendry figures out her true motive during the date, and feelings are revealed as well as their clothes. 😉

I really need someone to write this. 😩😩😩

summary:
How Arya and Sansa survived, summed up 
Sansa: I’m gonna lie and learn from my greatest adversary in order to survive in a place...
body:
How Arya and Sansa survived, summed up

Sansa: I’m gonna lie and learn from my greatest adversary in order to survive in a place where they would kill me in an instant

Arya: I’m gonna fucking kill anyone who dared to cross me or kill someone I love

The Hound in the background, crying: I am so proud of you two

summary: Gendrya modern AU! Arya and Gendry first met at a party of their mutual friend when she was fifteen and he was almost eighteen....
body:
Gendrya modern AU! Arya and Gendry first met at a party of their mutual friend when she was fifteen and he was almost eighteen. Since then they spent almost all the time together. It was the first love. Strong. Passionate. Pure. True. But their paths diverged when Gendry went to a university in another country.

They both matured. They have changed. Arya lives with her boyfriend, works a lot. Gendry runs his father’s business, preparing for the wedding with his bride. Their lives are routine and calm.

Seven years later they accidentally meet each other in their hometown. The youthful feelings between them flared up again.

This meeting turns upside down their planned lives.

summary: If the real Arya was married to Ramsey I would give it a week before either Arya killed him and ruled the North or that Jaqen...
question: If the real Arya was married to Ramsey I would give it a week before either Arya killed him and ruled the North or that Jaqen came to save his lovely girl.
answer:
You just reminded me of Weese’s death in Harrenhal! Weese also had a dog that everyone was afraid of, like they were scared of Ramsay and his dogs. Jaqen gave the dog meat spiced with basilisk blood and the dog attacked Weese and killed him. It was a very cruel death. They never showed it in Game of Thrones. Now, I see they purposefully used Jaqen’s idea to kill off Ramsay. I totally agree with you on this, if Arya was married to Ramsay Jaqen would relish in killing him. 

Thank you for bringing this up! Arya owes so much to Jaqen and the Faceless Men. She would have met poor Jeyne’s fate if they hadn’t helped her. 

I just want them to reunite already…

xoxo

summary: Things that were ultimately meaningless in the last season of thrones
body:
Things that were ultimately meaningless in the last season of thrones

Aegon Targaryen

Arya being a faceless man

Gendry’s return

Bran being the Three Eyed Raven

Jaime. Literally everything about him.

Cersei’s pregnancy

Yara’s kidnapping

Direwolves

summary: Sansa: Theon isn’t in love with me. Jon: Yes he is. Arya: Yes he is. Bran: Yes he is. Daenerys: Yes he is. The Night King: Yes...
body:
Sansa: Theon isn’t in love with me.

Jon: Yes he is.

Arya: Yes he is.

Bran: Yes he is.

Daenerys: Yes he is.

The Night King: Yes he is.

The Old Gods Themselves: Yes he is.

Theon: YES I AM!

blog.name: adamparrush
blog.title: there is freedom in the dark
blog.description: i am a direwolf, and done with wooden teeth.

tags: i can't believe that with all of got's gratuitous violence and suffering and gore. they minimized and watered down harrenhal of all things
only to have arya exchange cute banter with disney's version of tywin lannister
rereading those chapters was. brutal. but they are so so formative to arya's arc
and the larger story of war's effects overall
it's also interesting to compare arya in harrenhal to arya in braavos
in the former she is so utterly small and scared and alone
while in braavos she is comparatively so free and confident and immerses herself in the city completely
even though one would think it might be flipped since she's experienced a lot more loss by the time she's in braavos
and arya's her most morally dark in braavos in terms of killing
but that darkness doesn't necessarily coincide with her emotional state / ability to connect with people
and doesn't line up with her lowest / most vulnerable and terrified point which is at harrenhal
summary: “gendry had been sent to the forge; arya seldom saw him. as for those she served with, she did not even want to know their...
body:
“gendry had been sent to the forge; arya seldom saw him. as for those she served with, she did not even want to know their names. that only made it hurt worse when they died. most of them were older than she was and content to let her alone.”  

— arya vii, a clash of kings

i think this part is so revealing in just how traumatized arya is from being forced to witness the brutalities done by gregor clegane and his men on the way to harrenhal, and how horrific and terrifying harrenhal itself and arya’s experiences there are. this is arya stark, arya underfoot, who is always making friends, no matter the setting, no matter the people she’s with or their age or class or gender, who cannot isolate herself from others even when she purposely tries to, who is naturally curious and always wants to learn about and talk to the people who surround her. she makes new friends and allies at king’s landing, with yoren and his captives, with the brotherhood and at the places she stayed while traveling with them such as acorn hall, on the ship to braavos, in braavos itself. the only exception is harrenhal. even though she was not particularly safe or surrounded by people she could easily trust in any of these situations, it’s harrenhal that sticks out regarding arya’s isolation throughout her stay.

it’s true that she isn’t entirely isolated—she has gendry and hot pie, but they were her friends from traveling with yoren, and though her main interactions with jaqen occur at harrenhal, she knew him before as well and saved him, and he was the one who approached her and offered his help. but arya makes no new friends and doesn’t attempt to do so, doesn’t even want to know anyone’s name. of course arya not wanting to get to know people because it would only hurt worse when they died is partially a result of losing her loved ones too, but she makes friends with gendry, hot pie, lommy, and the rest, creates a pack of her own, even after ned’s death (and syrio’s), makes friends while with the brotherhood after learning of winterfell burning and the deaths of “bran” and “rickon”, and does the same in braavos even after the red wedding.

so imo it’s very telling that arya thinks this specifically at a time when the experiences of the journey with the mountain’s men—all the death and torture of smallfolk, lommy’s death—are fresh in her mind, and when she’s been reduced to a mouse working in harrenhal, the most terrified she’s been in the whole series, fearing beatings and worse every single day. any moments of hope—lord cerwyn, freeing the northmen—end up falling through and she’s just as isolated and friendless throughout the rest of her days there, even when it’s taken over by men from the north. the castle is full of people, many of them working alongside arya and likely as powerless as her, but the atmosphere of harrenhal—an utter nightmare of a place full of displays of dead bodies, and heads on spikes, and worse—and arya’s own headspace in it leads to her communication with others to stick to a minimum. the closest we ever see of her trying to make a new connection is elmar frey. 

she still listens and learns, her ability to gather information somewhat strengthened as a mouse, but she doesn’t truly converse with anyone unless necessary; most of all, she hides, and puts up a wall between her and the multitudes of strangers around her in a way that she really doesn’t at any other point in the series. which makes her final escape from harrenhal, and the fact that she instigates and plans it herself and takes gendry and hot pie along with her, even more incredible and powerful.

blog.name: who-is-azorahai
blog.title: Who is azorahai?
blog.description: actors, models, comic strips, comedians, movies, tv shows, ectomorphic cuties, fandom shit and music (mostly Adult Album Alternative). also, progressive politics, religion/atheism/anti-theism, the American Empire, and its war machine. police corruption. climate crisis/denial. alternative news. rants.

summary: Sophie Turner & Maisie Williams auditioning for the roles of Sansa & Arya Stark in 'Game of Thrones'
title: Sophie Turner & Maisie Williams auditioning for the roles of Sansa & Arya Stark in 'Game of Thrones'
